TopicTitle: Modding Mondays: Sum Dum Heavy Industries

Articles.Content: Robin “sumghai” Chang designed this parts pack to turn the Mk 1-2 command pod into an Orion pod while retaining the stock KSP artstyle. The pack includes new docking ports, fairings, a heat shield, a service module and much more to make the pod look the part. ThereÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s an impressive list of supported mods which includes Ferram Aerospace Research, Deadly Reentry, TAC Life Support and Connected Living Spaces, and you will need the AnimtedDecouplers, Realchute and ModuleManager mods installed for it to function fully. All in all, itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s a function-packed and very neat mod. More information & downloads in the [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/52362](**Forum Thread**!
One of my favorite mods. Nice to see it featured on the Daily Kerbal! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
I've never been keen to use mods that need other people's mods to fully function. If you have all the mods and something glitches, you never know who to talk to.

I've used this several times each time with mixed results (I will save my criticism for the main thread itself). In short, aesthetically, it is an incredible mod! Love it! It would be great if it could be incorporated into the stock game!
